description.originalText:
Rachel was a wonderful caregiver for our shy but creative 3yo girl. She helped her get through a rough patch in toilet training and was always finding engaging ways to keep our little one curious and active, including reading to our little one in Spanish and going on park adventures! 

She was very flexible and communicative with us parents as well. Would definitely recommend Rachel to anyone looking for a reliable and experienced caregiver for their child.

description.displayText: Rachel is wonderful! She was a nanny for our 4yo daughter (and, a few days a week, another 4yo friend). She picked the girls up from school, fed them lunch, and played with them all afternoon. My favorite thing about Rachel is that she always comes to work with ideas for fun, interesting things to do with kids. Whether that's painting pictures, playing dress-up, starting a cooking project, or exploring a new park or museum. She was even a pro at mediating the typical 4yo disputes and tantrums when they came up. My daughter loves hanging out with Miss Rachel. Although we no longer need a nanny, she's still our top choice for a babysitter!

description.displayText: Rachel has been our on-call baby-sitter during the school year and part-time nanny during summers for the past year.  She is fun, engaged, dependable and easy to talk to.  Our two boys,  ages 2 & 4, love her and get so excited when they find out that Rachel is coming.  One of the things they love about Rachel is that she's always willing to take them out-to parks, the pool, play-spaces, or even adventuring in the back yard!  It's a challenging time for all of us right now.  If you need someone you can trust to engage your little ones and take care of their needs, Rachel is a great choice!
